Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.check

Class CommonChecks

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.check.CommonChecks
public class CommonChecks
extends Object
Defines various common tests for arguments. These tests have short, informative error messages associated with them in case the argument does not pass the test. Many of them are plain, unadorned, method references and they only check what they advertise to be checking. None of them do a preliminary null-check on the argument, except those dedicated to this task (like notNull()). They rely upon being embedded within in chain of checks on a Check object, the first of which should be a not-null check.
Author:
Ayco Holleman

    • sizeEquals

      public static <X> ObjIntRelation<X> sizeEquals()
      Verifies that the argument's length or size is equal to a particular value. The type of argument must be one of:

      • an array
      • a CharSequence
      • a Collection
      • a Map
      • a Sizeable

      For any other type of argument this method throws an InvalidCheckException.

      Type Parameters:
      X - The type of the argument
      Returns:
      A Relation

    • sizeNotEquals

      For any other type of argument this method throws an InvalidCheckException.

    • indexOf

      public static <E,​ L extends List<? super E>> IntObjRelation<L> indexOf()
      Verifies that the argument is a valid index for a List operation like get or set. In other words, that the argument is greater than or equal to zero and less than the size of the list.
      Type Parameters:
      E - The type of the elements in the List
      L - The type of the List
      Returns:
      An IntObjRelation

    • toIndexOf

      public static <E,​ L extends List<? super E>> IntObjRelation<L> toIndexOf()
      Verifies that the argument is a valid "to" index for a List operation like List.sublist. In other words, that the argument is greater than or equal to zero and less than or equal to the size of the list.
      Returns:
      An IntObjRelation

    • asInt

      public static IntPredicate asInt​(Predicate<Integer> predicate)
      Converts the specified Predicate into an IntPredicate. Can be used to force the compiler to interpret a lambda as an IntPredicate rather than a Predicate.
      Parameters:
      predicate - A Predicate, supposedly in the form of a lambda
      Returns:
      The IntPredicate version of the Predicate

    • asObj

      public static <T> Predicate<T> asObj​(Predicate<T> predicate)
      Simply returns the argument. Can be used to force the compiler to interpret a lambda as a Predicate rather than an IntPredicate.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the argument being tested
      Parameters:
      predicate - A Predicate, supposedly in the form of a lambda
      Returns:
      The argument
